We've been working for a long time on adding color to Picbreeder
(http://pi=
cbreeder.org).  As some of you know from experience,
evolving black and whi=
te pictures with CPPN-like representations is
fairly straightforward, but a=
dding color is a major challenge.  Thanks
in large part to Nick Beato, who =
did the actual implementation on the
applet after many group discussions, w=
e now have an intuitive and fun
color evolution system that actually works.=
  An important aspect of
our color system for the continuity of the site is=
 that it allows you
begin with one of the preexisting black and white image=
s (if you want)
and it will evolve color into it seamlessly.  So all the ex=
isting
images can now be colorized!

We've just begun to start publishing s=
ome color images, which you can
see under our Newest Images category:

http=
://picbreeder.org/imagedisplay.php?type=3DCREATED&page=3D0

By the way, in =
case you did not know, Picbreeder also allows anonymous
publishing, so you =
don't need an account to play with and even publish
color pictures.

ken


=
